incidents.name: Scheduled builds not triggering

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause of the issue and will be working on a fix
We are currently investigating reports of scheduled builds not running on the platform.

incidents.name: Build queue and wait time due to slow cache fetching

incident_updates.body: During the investigation we found that cache sizes exceeding ~5GB are primarily affected. If your cache upload/download takes disproportionally long, as a quick workaround please try to lower your cache size bellow 5GB. We are working in the meantime with our underlying service provider partners on the permanent fix.
Our investigation into the root cause is still ongoing and we have applied mitigations to reduce the impact on our affected customers. More updates to follow.
We are currently investigating reports of longer build times impacting our customers. More updates to follow.

incidents.name: Builds not starting

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Today we acknowledged and fixed an issue with builds on the platform not starting. We are currently monitoring but the issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Error 500 on Dashboard and Settings pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Github Connection Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Third Party Integrations - GitHub API Requests

incident_updates.body:
Together with our third-party providers, we have now identified an underlying network issue causing intermittent, but common binary download errors in some customers builds with the following error message: connection reset by peer. Our team is currently resolving this issue and we’ll share an update once it’s done.  

Thank you for your patience.

affected_components.name: Third Party Integrations - GitHub API Requests

incident_updates.body:
Due to a third-party issue with Github, some customers might experience intermittent, but common binary download errors on their builds with the following error message connection reset by peer error. 
We are working on resolving this with Github as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Unable to update GitHub Checks Statuses

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The root cause has been mitigated on our side but we are continuing to monitor the situation.

For some period of time, GitHubCheck results were not reported to GitHub. Users should find pipelines (e.g. filtering for Pull Requests and commit messages) and check the status manually – then force merge the PR on GitHub (If the corresponding pipeline is green).
Alternatively, rebuild pipelines. New pipeline runs should be good now. Old PRs with still missing checks are unlikely to recover.

We have deployed a fix and are seeing progress. We are still monitoring the situation the results to be sure. We expect new pipelines to be running correctly and the system is retrying old messages. So it's likely that you will see statuses appearing on previous pipelines as well.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Continuing issues with hanging builds (MacOS only)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The root cause has been identified and fixed. We are no longer seeing elevated hanging build rates, but we will be continuing to monitor.
A possible root cause was identified and we rolled back a previous system change. We are monitoring the build statuses and at the same time investigating the root cause
A fix was released. However, the issue has not been fully resolved. We are continuing to monitor and adjust accordingly.

incidents.name: Concurrency based subscription service is down

incident_updates.body: This incident has now been resolved.
Every feature should work as expected and all plans should be back to normal. We are still closely monitoring all systems and wrapping up the incident soon.

A fix has been implemented and builds should be running as expected. You may still experience incorrect plan information on your billing page, which will be fixed soon.  We apologize for the disruption.

We are currently aware that our customers on our legacy subscription service plan are experiencing an error that affects their ability to build today. We are currently working on a fix for this, if you find yourself affected please contact our support team to help unblock you.

incidents.name: Issues with pull intermediate files and pull artifacts steps

incident_updates.body: Customers experienced issues with pull intermediate files and pull artifacts steps from 12:00 pm GMT until 16:35 GMT. This issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: DataDog Outage

incident_updates.body: DataDog Network Performance Management is operational again. Logs Management is generally working,

We are currently monitoring the loading issues on the DataDog web application. This issue is not affecting any Bitrise production services.

More info: https://status.datadoghq.com/incidents/nhrdzp86vqtp

incidents.name: Experiencing issues with the sign up flow

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Customers might experience issues with signing up. Our engineers are aware of this issue and are working on resolving it as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Pipelines reporting success on partial rebuild if the failing stage contained an “aborted with success” workflow

incident_updates.body: We have deployed a fix and verified that the issue is now resolved.

We’ve identified that this only occurs when the rebuilt pipeline stage contained a workflow build having the status “aborted with success”. If a pipeline stage contains failed workflows and the rebuild fails, we report the status correctly.
We’re working towards the resolution.

We see build status reported to git providers (e.g. GitHub) as success for partially rebuilt pipelines if the rebuild fails.
Only pipelines are affected, standalone builds aren’t, and only  when a partial rebuild gets triggered of an already run pipeline.
We are currently looking into the issue.

incidents.name: Issues with Apple ID Authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

If you are using Apple ID authentication, you may experience failures due to an ongoing issue. We're investigating our options, in case API key authentication is an option for you, we recommend switching to that method. 

More info: https://github.com/fastlane/fastlane/issues/21071

incidents.name: GitHub Checks Issue

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

You may have experienced an issue in the past roughly 3 hours with GitHub Chekcs. During this time, Checks were created with “Bitrise - <App name> - <workflow name>” name but GitHub registered required changes with “Bitrise” name only. If you experience this issue, you need to either re-run your checks again to get registered with the correct name or they need to temporarily override their GitHub branch protection rules.
We're experiencing an issue where GitHub Checks do not report status back to GitHub as expected. We're investigating the situation right now, will provide frequent updates.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Inconsistent merge refs in Git Clone Repository Step

incident_updates.body: We saw some issues in our Git Clone Repository Step when checking out the merge ref for a Pull Request: sometimes the merge ref was referencing an old commit which is incorrect. v7 version of this step introduced relying on merge refs, we rolled back to manual merging (6.2.2 version of the step) until further investigation. The fixed version is published as 7.0.3 so everyone using the latest pinned major 7.x.x (or minor 7.0.x) version will get the update automatically.

incidents.name: Linux builds experiencing errors

incident_updates.body: After investigating and identifying the issue is not on our side. Archive.ubuntu.com is currently struggling, so we have applied a workaround for the time being by switching package mirrors. Using apt will be seamless for all customers.

incidents.name: Experiencing build log issues on our Xcode 13.0 stack

incident_updates.body: We are working on providing an enhanced experience and structure for the build logs. Due to a misconfiguration in feature flags, the logs were routed to the wrong endpoint for the 13.0 stacks. This is why the logs were not accessible from the website. When the issue was discovered we fixed the feature flag configuration and created a script to load the logs to the correct place.
This incident has been resolved.
We can confirm that no new builds have been affected and issues with affected builds are being corrected retroactively.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Website Latency Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Currently we are experiencing issues with Javascript assets not loading correctly on the Website, causing 404 error responses, clearing your browser caches resolves the issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Experiencing increased queue times and build performance issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A third party provider experienced degraded performance which as a result impacted our network performance as well. The issue has been resolved and performance degradation can be no longer observed on our end. The engineering team is continuing to monitor.

This incident was composed of a mix of two issues. The core issue still being investigated happens to be a networking issue spread across different stacks. Initially some stacks such as Xcode 14.0 and 14.1 experienced higher than average queues. Our team was able to resolve the high queue issue that was delaying build start. We thank you for your patience as we continue to work on the networking issue.

We are currently experiencing higher-than-average queues on our Xcode 14.0 & 14.1. Our infra team is currently deploying additional resources to compensate and we are looking to also have positive improvements on the build performance across other stacks.
We are currently investigating this issue.
